intro: Turnera nana, commonly known as dwarf turnera, is a small evergreen shrub native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and dense foliage of elliptical, dark green leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, typically during the spring and summer months. It thrives in moist, well-drained soil and prefers partial to full shade, making it suitable for woodland gardens. Its ornamental value lies in its attractive foliage and delicate floral display.
